answers.answer: Hi,How are you?Pineal gland lies very close to the optic nerve. In some patient’s paralysis of lateral rectus muscle, and pneumocephalus and pineal gland abscess can occur as a postop complications.I would suggest you to let your neurosurgeon know about this problem. Please do not hesitate at all.Do keep us posted!

question: I am 8 weeks post pineal cyst resection for 4th cranial nerve palsy. I had a supracerebellar infratentorial sitting craniotomy. Very grateful that I have correction of vertical double vision.  Recovery somewhat complicated with a seizure, ataxia, and diabetes insipidus.  After brief rehab ataxia resolved, DI resolved with DDAVP given only a few times.  I feel great with no headaches and only fatigue/stamina issues and some transient issues getting my words out with overexertion.  I have noticed that I have an area of blurring in my eyes that was not there pre-op.  This seems worse in the mornings but I do notice it throughout the day as well.  I was on steroids post-op and tapered off with no problems.  It is difficult to explain but I notice the blurring in both eyes.  When I look at an Amsler grid I notice paracentral scotomas on the outer half of the chart with bowing out of the outside lines.  This seems somewhat transient and more "defined" at times.  I am  so grateful for the correction of my double vision and although the recovery was difficult (pneumocephalus, seizue, DI, ataxia) I would do it all over again. I saw 2 neuro-oph. who both diagnosed dorsal midbrain syndrome.  My question is probably stupid but should I even mention this issue to my neurosurgeon?  could this be swelling?  I had several post-op scans that did not show any problems.  It is difficult to say when this started because initially after the surgery I still had the double vision some days, with blurring and focus issues on other days.  I couldn't really start reading until a few weeks ago.Again I am so happy with my results that I don't want to seem like I am complaining or bringing up a new issue.  I am anxious to return to work ASAP and don't want to hold up my progress.  Thanks
title: pineal surgery
